text:
*Quote-Template PDF-Printer Question:*
Can I have in a quote-template a print page-header and print page-footer? One of those repeater-areas that appears on every page. I know the PDF-Printer support this normally. But does HubSpot support this Feature as well?
Does anyone know, is it possible to access a CSS file sitting in a theme from an external source? Like get the URL to it. I only get the minified version.

I’m in the process of wrapping up a theme and I want to provide theme options for buttons. I’d like to have three buttons (primary, secondary, tertiary)  a user can SET UP inside the theme options — and then have those translate so the user can select those options inside the modules.


behind the scenes the theme options should build the buttons in css, and place them into a simple class like button--primary or something… I think I know how to do that.

What I’m having a problem wiht is how I should be asking the user to set up the buttons.

Do I go with something that is “border color, background color, text color, border radius”
And then “hover border, hover background, hover text, hover border-radius” ---

Is there a better way?

I’m guessing the css isn’t coming through.

Angela — you’d likely need to do some combining or sharing of resources. Having two themes isn’t really a best practice…. so this will take some development work to make what you are looking to do happen
you could set up a print stylesheet, add html in there to do this, and give it print only styling, removing this from regular view and hiding those elements.
better if you create a pre-made style then just let the user to select if “Button - Primary” , “Button - Success” etc.
Do you have a screenshot/example you could link, I feel like I’m not understanding fully

Anyone ever come across this error before?
```[ERROR] Error validating template.
[ERROR] line 0: Template does not include the tag {{ standard_footer_includes }}. Needed for HubSpot analytics```
Doesn’t seem to be registering {% extends “./layouts/base.html” %} :confused:
may i see your base.html?
did you extend this on a custom template?
This is what i do on a custom template. base file is also the same with the HubSpot boilerplate

nah not really, it’s erroring on home, about and a new schdules template. my theme is based off the boilerplate. Was working fine before, I’ve uploaded it to another account, changed a few names on things and it just broke

```<!--
  templateType: page
  isAvailableForNewContent: true
  label: Home
  screenshotPath: ../images/template-previews/home.png
-->
{% extends "./layouts/base.html" %}

{% block body %}```
mine is pretty much identical. If I change isAvailableForNewContent to false it fixes itself :confused:

Here you go:

This is a custom button module where i add an option to select button class (primary, secondary etc.)
AHH I GOTCHA
So don’t set these up in theme options, but maybe have a stylesheet they can refer to
yup. you build the components and let them re-use it

i’d try moving the footer include tag higher up (like right under the header include tag

See if that works correctly, if that works correctly then there is an issue in the content/code between the header include and original footer include
thanks

<@U25PYL3Q8> Thanks, I get it. This is great for printing a separate logo or different styling. What I am trying to achieve is that on each subsequent printed page, the header and footer appear like on a letterhead. I found a tutorial to achieve this with tables. But therefor I need to restructure the template. When I have time I will try it with tables.
can you attempt it with fixed/sticky headers/footers?
Good point, I will try that as well.
